website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice that delivers optimal performance, but not as low profile or feature packed as some others.
pros: Lightweight yet rugged design that offers effective hearing protection
Customer satisfaction is backed by the manufacturer
cons: Somewhat bulkier to wear than other models we tested

customer_reviews.title: Best Ear Muffs
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know how good Ear Muffs could be until I got these. Great Product. Really appreciate that someone finally got them right. Good enough that I did a video where I dissected the two pairs these are replacing to figure out why these are SOOOoooo Much better and it makes it pretty clear why these Ear Muffs far exceed the competition. Thank You, Clear Armor, Love these Ear Muffs.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Garry

customer_reviews.title: They’re lying, They changed how these are made.
customer_reviews.text: They advertise “NASA” foam, but it is just a little scrap piece of cheap polyurethane foam. I had a pair that used the old foam then ordered another pair and they were different, cheaper. I modified them with some memory foam. Now they work much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great product, even better company.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a pistol class I was taking. These were by far the best protection on the market I could find and priced really well. They fit perfect and fold up nice. I keep them in my range bag. I also have to say the personal thank you note inside the packaging was a really nice touch. To top it off I received a personal email from the company asking if I received the product, and if it was anything less than perfect please let them know. You just don't get service like this anymore. I continue to be impressed. Please buy this product. This is an American company and I wish them nothing but success.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Werner

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and of limited effectiveness
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to make a very loud activity bearable for students sensitive to noise. They worked well enough for the students to participate in perhaps 2/3 of the activity. Also bought a set to allow me to sleep in a room with a loudly snoring colleague-not good enough. These are quite uncomfortable- too tight, and I have a small head. Both students concur they became unpleasant to wear rather quickly. Contacted seller and basically told "too bad," but there it is.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: These do not cancel noise
customer_reviews.text: I should have gone by "you get what you pay for". These were too good to be true. They absolutely do not cancel out noise such as conversation. The only thing they do is slightly muffle it, you an hear music / whole detailed conversations. Do not buy these. These do not perform at all.
customer_reviews.author: D. M.

customer_reviews.title: Does what I needed them to do
customer_reviews.text: Working as a safety officer on a shooting range these ear muffs are great. I have a larger head and these are a comfortable fit. I actually forget to take them off during cease fires most times. The muffs do very well damping the noise level being generated on the line. Working a 9 hour shift with firearms going bang around you the whole time can give you a nasty headache, as well as hearing damage if you don't have the right protection. With my old ear muffs I also needed to wear ear plugs to get the needed protection. The ClearArmor muffs work fine by themselves and are a lot more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R. Hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Meh...not great but not bad. Bought for my autistic teenager. It absolutely helps but i would invest in the Bose if you can. For the autism mom/dads out there: he can still hear a crying baby if the family is sitting within 3 rows on a plane, very soft/smooth on ears, restaurants would be an issue during busy times (which we don't do for obvious reasons), blocks out the noise of the dishes/chatter when not busy dining times, wouldn't use for fireworks....heck we don't do fireworks lol. Of course each child's senerory is different but I am absolutely keeping these for back ups.
customer_reviews.author: Lagunabeachmom

customer_reviews.title: Not for low frequency noise - Not for fireworks!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my daughter. We live in an area where fireworks is frequent year round and she is very much bothered by it. After reading reviews stating their effectiveness for fireworks, and the product manufacturer's claim about their new air pocket technology, I felt confident in my purchase. Turns out however that my confidence was in great error. That air pocket actually amplifies outside sound. It echos sound like in a tunnel. If anyone is considering purchasing these for fireworks or any other low frequency sound.. Forget these, they fail miserably!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Antony Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great seal.  Comfortable.  Blocks sound well.
customer_reviews.text: Great muffs. good seal and do a good job of blocking sound. We used to keep mostly the crappy Harbor Freight ones around, but once I got one pair of these, everyone kept grabbing them - thus ordering more. Update: Ordered three more sets, but the ones I got have a much harder foam, so they do not seal. I contacted the company, and they said they did change the foam. In looking back, i see I paid about $24 for the first pair, and only $14 each for the next 3. I guess they dropped the quality so they could drop the price. Too bad. Back to Peltor... See my video for more details.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected, but maybe good enough.
customer_reviews.text: They aren't really "the highest nrr," as advertised, since the highest nrr is 34 and these are 31, but 31 seems sufficient for my needs. What bothers me more is that I could have got some low profiles for less with the same nrr, but chose these thinking from other reviews that they were made in America. They are made in Taiwan. I paid an extra $4 for bulkier muffs with the same nrr because they were made in Taiwan instead of China. Doh! They're also pretty tight, which might prove uncomfortable after a while, but they have to be a little snug to do the job (and I have a pretty big head).
customer_reviews.author: WirelessMike

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I hoped; sweaty ears.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help block out the sound of dogs barking. Currently watching a house of three dogs, one of which has a very high pitched bark the actually makes my ears ring. These do protect from the sting of the bark but don't block as much noise as just using earplugs did. I switched to these instead of earplugs because it started to hurt to insert them. These will work fine I just wish they did more. I put my hair up in a pony when I wear them to try and create the best seal. They do cause my ears to sweat, they are always sweaty when I take them off. Gross.
customer_reviews.author: Txi

customer_reviews.title: Great for shooting, not for studying
customer_reviews.text: I've used these muffs over the last two years for pistol shooting practice and they work marvelously well. However, the second pair I purchased to deal with chatty coworkers in the office have exposed some comfort issues. These muffs exert a lot of clamping force on the sides of my head, which becomes particularly uncomfortable after an hour or so. Also, despite the exceptionally large ear cups, I cannot comfortably wear wired earbuds underneath these muffs.
customer_reviews.author: Jon G.

customer_reviews.title: They fit a bit snug.even on my little head, BUT that also helps create a more effective seal.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE! Need them for a very noisy household. There is always the TV on all day, blasting the new, others that cant help make noise due to disabilities. It sometimes gets so loud and frustrating, I had to do something to curb the noise, which can otherwise drive you crazy. I can still hear these noises, but they are muffled to a very tolerable level. Now I can think straight, and not nearly as distravted.
customer_reviews.author: Janma

customer_reviews.title: The first thing I noticed with the new set was the material covering the ear appeared to have been improved as it was softer for
customer_reviews.text: Following receipt of the original set, there was need to contact the seller. Following our discussion, seller offered to send me another set which I received today. The first thing I noticed with the new set was the material covering the ear appeared to have been improved as it was softer for a better seal. Although I've not had an opportunity to field the ear muffs, I can tell you the fit is comfortable and the larger earpieces do a better job of sealing the ear than a pair of Peltor ear muffs I purchased elsewhere recently. I am happy with the product and equally happy to give it a five star rating.
customer_reviews.author: leeanders

customer_reviews.title: Good noise mitigation, but uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These work very well at reducing noise, but they are fairly uncomfortable. The headband on these was way too tight when I got it. I don't have a big head by any stretch of the imagination, but I still needed to place these over some books I had to stretch them out before I could wear them. Additionally, the foam padding is not very soft. I think it's supposed to be a memory foam of some kind, but it simply feels hard, especially when cold. They seem kind of big, but for the price I didn't expect ultra thin, premium ear protection. These have been relegated to loaners and lawn mowing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Night Shyam-alien

customer_reviews.title: Like the earmuffs
customer_reviews.text: Like the earmuffs, they are snug but should be for the protection they offer, and I have a large head! I have used them at my indoor range and have worn them for extended periods, displacing one side to have and hear conversations before resuming shooting and DO NOT find them uncomfortable. I like the system they use for fitment, all in all, I do like them. People who point out the snugness have to understand that is necessary for them to do their job! Time will tell on the durability and longevity, but initial usage seems to indicate a well made product
customer_reviews.author: Hogman

customer_reviews.title: I have a slim face so I can't image what it must feel like for people with broad faces
customer_reviews.text: This works on the principle of squeezing really tight against your ears.I have a slim face so I can't image what it must feel like for people with broad faces.On the packaging it says it is a snug fit and it suggest leaving it overnight on some books to make it less snug.If someone is hammering near you you're going to hear it just mildly less.You could have this on and still listen to your youtube videos from your laptop at a medium level. I have no idea why the world is still so backward in noise cancelling technology,even bose mainly works for airplane background noise while you listen to music.Some people just want silence without having music playing.
customer_reviews.author: hunter27

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: They're so so... definitely not for shooting range protection, so don't buy them for that. But they're okay for people with hyperacusis who like to use the blender a lot like myself. You can still have a conversation in them and you can hear everything someone else says, so I'd say it's for around-the-house stuff like vacuum cleaning, blenders, etc. But it doesn't really cancel out much noise. I'm not sold on them, but I think it's fine for now.
customer_reviews.author: Golden R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, comfortable, and very good noise reduction
customer_reviews.text: These don't need batteries, they aren't noise cancelling, but they do an excellent job with noise protection. I can hear normal conversation, that is to be expected, but they really muffle high-pitched and loud noises. Foam ear plugs are uncomfortable and do not work for me. I use these for wood-working as the saws and power tools can be extremely loud. I'm rather small, I was afraid these wouldn't fit, but they are adjustable and do fit a smaller head size. They are comfortable, and don't squash my ears. I'm very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Pay more, get something else.
customer_reviews.text: Low price, but would rather have paid more for better. Foam is jammed in, puckered. Earpieces not washable, low grade plastic. May have high NRR, but no perception of such while wearing. I'm only satisfied to use as spare.
customer_reviews.author: John R S

customer_reviews.title: Top-Notch Ear Protection - Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: My friend is a DIY enthusiast, he is usually to be found in his workshop cutting something up or grinding something to smithereens. That means power tools and these defenders are really, really good. He has very sensitive hearing so some brands just don’t work that well for him. I found these for him and he said these were the best ear muffs he's ever had! I've tried them out myself and they work really well, they seem to shut out those high-pitched tones which are so annoying to the ear. They’re also really well-priced! My friend is very happy with them. Try it out if you need some reliable protection for your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Trading Robot

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations.
customer_reviews.text: When I buy any product, I expect it to meet my expectations, so for me to rate something as EXCEEDING expectations is meaningful. These ear muffs impressed me in the first few seconds I put them on, as the sound from the TV in front of me all but disappeared. Now, the only caveat I would add is that the construction is adequate, but not overly robust. The construction is what you might expect at this price point, and may not be the quality a heavy user might need. But for the occasional times you are using a leaf blower, circular saw or having the mother-in-law over, they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Steve in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t quiet noises very well.
customer_reviews.text: These don’t cancel much noise at all, maybe 10% at best, so not very effective for me. Didn’t effectively deaden construction noise, loud bangs, music, talking, tv, traffic noises, none of those sounds were much quieter. They are also very tight to the point of causing a headache which means I can’t wear them for an extended period of time. I’ll look for a more effective noise cancelling version.
customer_reviews.author: AZ 9

customer_reviews.title: These things are great! Worn by themselves
customer_reviews.text: Just bought my second pair. These things are great! Worn by themselves, they block tons of noise! Saws, obnoxiously loud lawnmower, whatever you've got. With earbuds too it's double the quiet, plus music. I only wish the padding was domed a little bit more in the center, so that it wouldn't hit the outside edge of earbuds. They still works for this purpose, but depending on the size of the earbud can be a little uncomfortable as it drives them into your ear.
customer_reviews.author: mendo101

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: The reason I like your folding ear muffs is they work REAL WELL. I have had my first pair for a couple years now I think and they replaced another set I had that had the build in noise reduction. I had that set for a year before the batteries died and not long after they broke. I purchased my first pair from you and they worked well. I had a need for a second set and I just feel this set is better than the first. They seem more comfortable not by much and they seem to keep out more noise, which is very helpful when running my tractor.”
customer_reviews.author: Myron Benner

customer_reviews.title: Not good for big ears.
customer_reviews.text: These ear muffs are really too small for someone with big ears. I am a big guy with ears proportionate for my size. These ear muffs will seal if I tuck my ears inside them. I haven't worn them for an extended period of time yet, but seem a bit small for me. The sound attenuation for these are very good however. Edit: 4/20/2020 After having worn these for 8 hours or so mowing the lawn, I have changed my rating from 3 to 4 stars. They are still a bit small but quite comfortable, more so than I first thought.
customer_reviews.author: Marty B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned these for about four years and they are still in great condition and functioning well. I originally bought them for hearing protection while mowing but I’ve also worn them while using other equipment like saws, leave blower, etc. They are comfortable to wear even with my safety glasses on. I took them with me on a military cargo plane and they did a better job than just the issued ear plugs. I’ve been very pleased with the quality of these.
customer_reviews.author: R.S.

customer_reviews.title: My son who has autism LOVES these headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones for my teenaged son who has autism and is very sound sensitive. We received these headphones today and my son put them on and immediately gave a huge smile and a ‘thumbs up’! Your product made my son happy which in turns makes me a happy momma. I will definitely share your name and product within my autism network of mamas. Thank you again!
customer_reviews.author: My Native Ways

customer_reviews.title: Great ear protection.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these safety earmuffs to use when using motorized leaf blower, weed eater, lawn mower and other noisy equipment. They are excellent at reducing the noise. Wish I had found them sooner. One word of caution, if you work with hazardous equipment like chainsaws, be aware that at idle you may not hear it with these earmuffs on. I can barely hear my lawn mower and leaf blower at idle when using them. Just thought this might be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, tight, and fit!
customer_reviews.text: They definetly block out noise. They are super duper snug. They will fit kids for sure, as long as they are not super tiny. We bought these for our son to use while on the riding lawn mower as he likes to "help" us with chores. They will be good for shooting too. We like how compact they are when not in use, this is great for the gun safe. They could be considered a youth size or womens, because they are so snug and the ear holes are not very big, big enough for adult ears, but not large ears. Very tight fitting
customer_reviews.author: Taz

customer_reviews.title: They really kill gun blast noise
customer_reviews.text: These really work for me. They are a basic non-electronic headset. They fit my head snuggly but not overly tight and really kill gun blast noise. They have deep sealing cushions that mold around the bows of my shooting glasses. The ear cups are large and permit the use of additional in the ear plugs for days when I shoot at an indoor range. They have a generous range of adjustment (again based on my head, yours may vary.) They are much quieter than my old Peltors and about half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Graf

customer_reviews.title: Better than another brand
customer_reviews.text: These were so good at canceling out home background noise that I got a second pair for my office (it is open plan). Reduces a lot of noise, I can concentrate deeply. I was surprised how well they worked but also I could hear when someone called my name. They don't make it totally silent, if the next desk has a conversation i can still hear it but muffled enough to ignore. I even wear them when nothing is going on because they give such a deep sense of concentration. I got a different brand for an alternative, but returned those because this brand worked so much better.
customer_reviews.author: cornerExit

customer_reviews.title: and this product fits comfortably. I've only used it a couple of times ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow head, and this product fits comfortably. I've only used it a couple of times so far (because how often do you have to mow your lawn in the summer?), but it has worked very well. I listen to music through my earbuds -- at a comfortable volume -- with the ClearArmor 141001 Shooters Hearing Protection helping to hold the earbuds in place while significantly muting the noise of my lawnmower and power tools. My only complaint would be that I can't hear anybody talking to me. They have to wave and/or shout to get my attention. I guess that just means the product works.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morrell

customer_reviews.title: Honestly they must have changed something.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I have no idea how these get such good reviews. Maybe they used to make them better. They arrived damaged with one ear muff disconnected and I can see why. The plastic is extremely cheap that holds the muffs together. It doesn't sit well at all. While I have no doubt the ear muffs themselves will block out sound the head band and supporting pieces are the cheapest I have ever seen. Seriously maybe these were good in the past. But for now they are not worth purchasing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Husband plays drums
customer_reviews.text: These ear muffs worked perfectly for me. The drum set is in the living room. There are times when I want to be in the kitchen or another adjoining room when drum practice was going on but it wasn’t possible because the drums were so loud. I tried earplugs but they just couldn’t hack it. These earmuffs reduced the volume of the drums significantly! And I can comfortably wear my earbuds under the muffs! I wish I had thought of getting these earlier. They fit comfortably and snugly. I would recommend them to anyone looking for the next level in earmuffs!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Durable. Reduces noise significantly. A good buy.
customer_reviews.text: This Clear Armor ear muffs is a good buy. I have been using the same pair for over 2 years. I visit construction sites regularly. The muffs are easy to wear, simple to clean, and reduces noise significantly. The only problem I have encountered is that the rubber/plastic on the ear pieces surrounding the ear become somewhat hard, but not brittle, over time. So, that can affect comfort over the long run. But it’s a minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: JKN

customer_reviews.title: They cancel the noise very well
customer_reviews.text: I am light sleeper and I bought them with the purpose to use them to sleep when I am traveling with other people. I wouldn't use them every day to sleep but for short terms yes. Only thing is you have to sleep facing up because if you turn your head sideways they are a little uncomfortable because of the thickness but I guess that is necessary in order to cancel the noise so I prefer that than nothing. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MARIAMLOSANGELES

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I thought I wrote a review for these but I guess I forgot! I bought these on prime day last year and was pleasantly surprised by an email directly from the owner making sure I was satisfied with the product. While I haven’t actually started shooting yet (I’ve been meaning to take a class), I’ve ended up using these in my office when some coworkers talk loudly and I need to get stuff done. They work extremely well in blocking out sound so I can concentrate and they’re way more affordable than $300 noise-canceling headphones. Great product and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: frugal athlete

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: I got this to quite the atmosphere of my office suite that houses about 50 of us in cubicles. I have a little adult ADD and it's hard to concentrate when you can hear other peoples phone conversations, laughing, typing, talking etc. 4 stars because I was hoping they'd really give me some silence, but they do a decent job of dulling out most of the sound. I can still hear people talking in my immediate area , but they're muffled. When I put in my ear buds without music that makes it even better and with some soft classical music, it's like being in a world all by myself. - Finally peace. -
customer_reviews.author: angeleverlast

customer_reviews.title: Great value for aggressive sound dampening
customer_reviews.text: These block a lot of sound. I use this pair as a backup to some smaller, active hearing protection. In particular I use these at an indoor range that is setup to allow for all types of rifle shooting. The lane dividers are diamond plate aluminum that somehow seem to amplify sound so I picked up these cans and my head no longer feels like it spent an hour in a hardware store paint mixer when I leave. My head is a good sized melon so these are snug. I can wear them for an hour but I wouldn't want to wear them longer. The tightness is part of why these are so quiet so it's a decent trade off.
customer_reviews.author: scihawkTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Perfect aid for Meditation
customer_reviews.text: Do you meditate? Since I purchased this ear muff chiefly for this purpose I can't say enough. I have got so used to beautiful silence during meditations that I slip into a meditative mood the moment I slip these on. Will not shut off all sounds (which I don't think was the purpose of the ear muff) but noise, certainly "yes". Initial advertisements would display the db levels but currently the ads don't show that. I wonder why? Fits well on the ears and on your head. Wish the metal had been made out of steel and I would have given a 5 star rating. Otherwise this is a super product, worthy of its price.
customer_reviews.author: Subash S L

customer_reviews.title: Making My Autistic Son's Day Quieter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these safety ear muffs for my 21-year-old Autistic son, who was having difficulty in a new day program that is a bit noisier than school. He loves them! They fit well and are quite effective, and just knowing that he has them around for the noisy times calms him down. They are very well made and highly recommended! I also love the customer service - I've already had an email from Gary, making sure everything was going well with the ear muffs. I don't see that much in today's impersonal world. I'm happy to support Gary and his company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boy are these things TIGHT on your ears.
customer_reviews.text: If you like to put your head in a vise, and tighten it down until your nose might bleed, then buy these. Sure, they help dampen down sound, but the discomfort they bring you will distract you from the sound anyway. They suggest that you spread out the headphones around something thick for several days prior to use. I suggest they do that for us in their factory. I tried that, but it did not help very much. Or for very long. Not recommended. Unless you enjoy the head vise method.
customer_reviews.author: James Samas

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, just buy them.
customer_reviews.text: They are a bit big and I believe they are the older style but they look, fit, and work great. As a matter of fact, I bought my fiancé a different pair and will need to get these for her because they work much better than her “more streamlined looking” ear protection. I will gladly buy another pair from Gary. I know Gary is the owner because he had a note guaranteeing my satisfaction or immediate action in the box and followed up with an email one week later. I like that, nice touch Gary. Buy these shooters ear muffs. They are great, good quality (seemingly), guaranteed by the owner and inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Sean-P

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat 'em!!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding value. I have owned various types of hearing protection over the years but, these muffs are the best I have ever used for noise suppression. I wore them on the firing range. I used five different weapons, of various calibers, firing over 200 rounds. Not only did they do the job but, they were tight fitting and comfortable. I would recommend them to anyone who wants excellent comfort, and great noise suppression at a terrific price.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Addison

customer_reviews.title: Kind of small
customer_reviews.text: I guess I must have a huge head, because even with these fully adjusted out to the maximum size, they just barely extend down low enough to fully cover my ears. If I wear a toboggan or baseball hat, they will not reach low enough to cover my ears. That's unfortunate, because when I use the snow blower, I like to wear a toboggan and when I mow in the summer, I like to wear a baseball hat. Sigh. Also, while using them with the snowblower (without my toboggan), it still seems pretty loud. I got these to get away from wearing ear plugs, but I may need to go back to them.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: They're not adjustable for those of us with fa..big heads
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 pair, one for my wife and one for myself. While they do the job for her, they're very uncomfortable for me as they don't adjust to accommodate those of us with big heads, unlike others that I've owned in the past. Thinking that perhaps it was just my ignorance and that Clear Armor could help, I sent them a note and never heard back from them which was a surprise since they included a "please contact me if you have any questions" card in the box with the ear protectors. I can only assume that the contact card was meant as packing material
customer_reviews.author: Toeknee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ear protection
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Clear Armor 141001 ear muffs in Oct 2018 and have been using them ever since in the kitchen when I run my Vita-Mix Super 5000 blender (92 dB on high). The ear muffs are excellent! I wanted something that did not need batteries. These feel soft on my head and provide excellent protection against the noise. I keep them in a little basket under my kitchen island so they are handy. I would definitely recommend these ear muffs for other purposes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Darcy

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Keeps the Noise down
customer_reviews.text: I bought for shooting at an indoor range. Were a bit tight at first. However I got used to them quickly. (I have a medium to small head, so if you have a large head, maybe buy something for your size.) The ear muffs really knocked the shooting noise way down. I could hardly hear my instructor. But that's the level of noise reduction you want. Well made and I think they should last. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: PK1950

customer_reviews.title: These are really nice
customer_reviews.text: My initial reaction was not favorable. They were tight, the padding was hard, and they were uncomfortable. But after leaving them stretched out for a few days, they are great. The pads cover and seal around your ears. The noise reduction is fantastic. I use them for shooting, and when the next lane fires that big magnum revolver, you can feel the blast but it doesn't bother your hearing. No problems with comfort even after an hour of shooting. Started using them in the shop also for my power tools; easier that messing with the ear plugs. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Flashlight

customer_reviews.title: GREAT EAR PROTECTION!
customer_reviews.text: Reviewed by Linda Clifton: My brother-in-law first showed my husband and I these ear muffs. They almost totally block out all sound (the best I have ever tried). They fit very snug. Some said their glasses broke or prevented a good seal but I tried these on with glasses as did my husband with no problem. Perhaps you could have trouble if the stems on your glasses are wide and thick but no problem at all with ours. I highly recommend them for ear protection. They were delivered very fast by the seller with a nice card with email address if you are not totally satisfied. I would definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: L.K. Clifton

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and quiet
customer_reviews.text: These are mostly used for indoor shooting so I was looking for good noise suppression, comfort and fits in my range bag. I got what I wanted. They do a good job keeping the sound level down, I've worn them for three hours at a time and they're comfortable and they fold into the handle to minimize size. My only concern is the metal pins that fold. They work fine but I wonder if they will last. If I have any issues I'll update the review. Overall - worth the money and I like them.
customer_reviews.author: davec

customer_reviews.title: They deaden noise slightly better then my very old worn out Howard leight l3 ...
customer_reviews.text: They deaden noise slightly better then my very old worn out Howard leight l3 earmuffs.They have a very cheap feel to them compared to the l3.And i can't put them on with one hand like I can with the l3 or pelter earmuffs.They seem to be made the same as the l3 and pelter's,A plastic shell with foam insert's.But the l3's have an aluminum block glued to the inside of the shell.It's possible the plastic shell is slightly thicker on the safty ear muffs. They are light weight and comfortable and do as good if not slightly better at blocking out sound than the l3's and the l3's slightly better than the pelter H10 A.
customer_reviews.author: fmcon

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered them so we could walk a mile long bridge over a beautiful bay close to where we live, and endure the noise from all the traffic. My husband hasn't used his yet but I've tried them about 3 times, so far, and feel delighted to be able to walk the bridge and look out onto a picture postcard view, and not have my body in "fight or flee mode" from the enormous amount of traffic noise. They fit snugly and the noise is greatly diminished. Thank you for engineering and providing a truly great product that works well as a noise reduction device.
customer_reviews.author: Proceed to go

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier with these hearing protectors as I have super sensitive hearing
customer_reviews.text: Really great hearing protection. I have very sensitive hearing due to a neurological problem, my family says I have "dog hearing"! I can get a headache in less than a minute from some sounds that doesn't bother anyone else in the car, like the interference on AM radio. I put these on and it was great! There were some noise that I knew would give me a headache, even with regular ear plugs in, these blocked it totallyt. I couldn't be happier with these hearing protectors. I'd recommend that anyone around loud noise or like me with sound sensitivity get a pair of these.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne O

customer_reviews.title: I wear these to sleep!
customer_reviews.text: I wear these to sleep because I live in a poorly made building and I have insane neighbors. at first it was uncomfortable to sleep with them on, but I’ve gotten used to it and they actually help me from not sleeping on my stomach, which my chiropractor is thankful for. It’s easy to adjust and get to a comfortable size on my head. They are the only thing that keeps my neighbors‘ sounds to a tolerable level! Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Taylor

customer_reviews.title: these babies really do the job!!
customer_reviews.text: I make my own cat food. When I do, I generally make about a month's worth, so my electric grinder really grinds away during the second grind. I had been using ear buds, they helped some, but were a bit of a pain to continuously have to stop and adjust. Finally, decided there had to be a better way, and after reading lots of reviews, decided on the ClearArmor product. Got these two weeks before making cat food again, wore them, adjusted them as reviews suggested, and... WOW!! What a difference these have made! Okay! This is certainly not a standard application...but these babies really do the job!!
customer_reviews.author: Pattycakes

customer_reviews.title: Not noise cancelling but excellent noise suppression
customer_reviews.text: I have several different hearing suppression muffs and this ClearAarmor pair is the best I've seen. Some users have complained about the lack of head adjustment (especially too tight) but this is easily remedied by gently reverse bending the top. Used to mow on a subcompact tractor with deck - a rather noisy affair. Cuts the noise dramatically - even with glasses worn. And, it's comfortable enough for hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: robosolo

customer_reviews.title: The best in comfort and noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and style of these ear muffs. I recently brough it to a shooting range this past weekend and it was effective enough in blocking out the background noise. I'm not saying its completely silent, but it definitely wasn't loud at all. It's comfortable and very easy to adjust to my head or even to my boyfriends head when putting it on. The best part about it, is when you bunch it up it does fold into a smaller size which makes it very easy to carry or even store. It's lightweight and just overall looks simple w/ the black color. I have recommended this product and would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine

customer_reviews.title: it is outstanding
customer_reviews.text: amazing quality for very little money we just ordered a second one for me. wife liked the first one so much. she has a very loud 22 magnum and my pocket pistols (32 in summer and 380 in winter) are loud. i also occasionally shoot a 223 mini 14 with those blue tip ballistics that say "the cure for your projectile dysfunction" they are loud. it works well with all.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Blackmon

customer_reviews.title: Blocks Sounds as Promised!
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews for various ear muffs when selecting them for my husband. It was hard to choose, because there were so many contradictory reviews. I was going for a high sound blocking rating. My husband was very impressed by the construction & sound blocking ability of the ClearArmor 141001 ear muffs when he put them on Christmas Day. He also liked that they fold up. The ear muffs are more comfortable than the ones he had already. He wore them when sawing in the garage and they blocked sound better than the other ear muffs he previously used. Thank you ClearArmor!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Love2Knit

customer_reviews.title: Great protection !
customer_reviews.text: I have worn 3M Peltor ear muffs for years mowing and at the race track. They provide good protection. These are better. They are more comfortable, lightweight and are quieter. They appear to be well made. My shipment was quick and very well packaged for product protection. As they are reasonably priced for the quality, I highly recommend them. I would not hesitate to reorder if needed . I have some hearing loss and tinnitus from years of automotive race car noise, guns and noisy equipment when I did not have the sense to wear protection. Protect yours, buy a pair and wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I can't say enough good things about these
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about these. I have a noise sensitive kid (she does not have autism) and these headphones have really cut down on her anxiety in situations. We have found them useful at times of high anxiety whether noise is a factor or not. Example: we had a tree cut down in our yard a few weeks ago, our 5yr old had anxiety over a branch falling on our house and the prospect of loud noise. She wore the headphones and it really calmed her. I wish we would have bought them a few years ago. The size adjusts so they will fit an adult's head and our 2yr old's.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S

customer_reviews.title: I could hear the difference.
customer_reviews.text: I took these to an indoor shooting range yesterday and was VERY please with their performance. I have another pair of good quality ear muffs that are rated at 30dB attenuation. These are noticeably better at 34 dB. Decibels are logarithmic so it stands to reason. They are comfortable to wear . The seals conform around shooting glass temples and seal. These fold up very compactly and even tough the ear-cups are larger than my other muffs they still take up less room in my shooting bag. The wire supports seem a bit thin and flimsy so we will see how they hold up although I think with a little care in folding they should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... hand it to you and your company for a great product that is helping me very much each day ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to hand it to you and your company for a great product that is helping me very much each day I go to work. I work in a metal fabrication plant where we do window curtains for the glass envelope buildings in Austin etc. The shop has a lot of noise at times when the saws, the drummer, drills and so forth are in operation. Having this ear muff reduces the high pitch sound from these machines and I feel may ear getting the required relief. This truly is a blessing.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Can not believe how comfortable these ear muffs are for how tightly the wrap to the head! Sure, you sweat pretty easy in them if you wear them for extended periods, but the comfort is definitely first rate for such a low price. I can see myself wearing these around like headphones just to have some quiet time. Once you make sure the muffs are secured completely around each ear, the sound attenuation is startling. I could really only hear the lower end sounds (like rumbling, footsteps, my heartbeat etc) and the higher frequencies were reduced to muffles.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product.
customer_reviews.text: Clear Armor from Windsor, CO, makes some of the worst products I have experienced in my 75 years of life. Their professional ear muffs are terrible. As soon as I took them out of the box, they fell apart. I don’t know how these people sleep at night selling such a poor product. I threw them away - not worth returning.
customer_reviews.author: William Cordonnier

customer_reviews.title: Very Good NRR
customer_reviews.text: As a former Manage of Safety, I am very familiar with various protective equipment devices. With respect to hearing protection, I always wanted our employees to have the best hearing muffs or ear plugs that provided the highest noise reduction. After wearing these muffs, I was very impressed with the comfort, the seal around the temple pieces of my glasses, and the noise attenuation provided.
customer_reviews.author: El Supremo

customer_reviews.title: Seem to work great!
customer_reviews.text: I have not done any shooting with these yet, so I'll update this when I do. I will say that I was watching tv when I tried these on for the first time and I couldn't hear the tv anymore. If that's any indication how good they will be in the range, they should be awesome. Update after shooting with them: I shot at the gun range yesterday with these muffs on. They worked very well for hearing protection. The shot sound was muffled very well. These are well worth the money. I hope they end up being durable and long lasting muffs.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit
customer_reviews.text: Very cost effective but didn't stop enough of the gun shots noise as others that I use in the lower prices units out there. Main issue I had and my son had was it hurt the sides of your head within minutes to much to wear. They just don't expand enough in my opinion. We had to return them immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Happy mike

customer_reviews.title: Blocks out all noises to protect the human ears
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a headset to protect your ears from noise damage this is the ticket. Very pleased. I use them when I am using the VPI 16.5 Record cleaning machine to protect what's left of my hearing. They are also great when cutting the grass. Cuts out all the damaging noises almost makes you feel like you're in a sound proof booth. Would recommend these to anyone, buy now.
customer_reviews.author: Erik De Jonge

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and light, totally functional as described! AWESOME for drumming.
customer_reviews.text: Used them just a day ago for protection while rehearsing on the drums for an upcoming event, putting them over my in ear monitors for extra isolation. THESE MUFFS ARE FANTASTIC!!!!! With my IEM's in and these over, all I could hear was the perfect mix from the band coming in through my IEM's, without the sound of drums forcing me to raise the volume of the IEM's to ear destroying levels. I may use them for this specialized purpose, but I will be recommending these for anyone I know who needs ear protection in ANY situation. They are comfortable, light and easy to stow away.
customer_reviews.author: Eliezer Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great no frills ear protection for the pistol range
customer_reviews.text: I have a big round mellon head (hat size 7 7/8) and these fit snugly, but are comfortable. I regularly use them as my only ear protection on indoor pistol ranges and find the sound attenuation to be outstanding. Despite their size they fold into a compact package that easily fits in my range bag. The earmuffs are too fat for rifle shooting since they interfere with making a good cheek weld, but a good no frills basic solution for the pistol range.
customer_reviews.author: DaveDubya

customer_reviews.title: Snug Fit and Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Its a very Nice Product for Equipment which has Db rating up to 100. Anything Over it, you will feel the pressure little by little. I have a Blower which is 110 Db. and this doesn't give me lot of time to get my Job done, so I use those disposable ones along with this to give me a smooth session. Over All, it is Quieter and Comfortable Ear muff of all the ones I tried So far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effective noise reduction.  Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: We use these during lawn mowing and chain saw operation. They are quite effective and very comfortable. I like the way they fit over my ball cap without adding any noise. Can't comment on durability as I've used them only a few times. They look and feel well built. I'll do a followup if they do not stand the test of time. I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: RGJ

customer_reviews.title: Ready 'blocks noise'!
customer_reviews.text: I received the 141001 Shooters ear muffs very quickly – and in ‘off the shelf’ shape. I have not been to the range to try them out in that environment, but putting them on while listening to a ‘very loud’ TV resulted in a very noticeable and large reduction in audio volume. I’m confident they’ll meet my needs for passive ear protection and my son is going to order sets for himself and his sons as well. We had initially thought about ‘active’ headsets, but our shooting range actually recommended against them.
customer_reviews.author: PopaJoe

customer_reviews.title: Good quality hearing protection
customer_reviews.text: The hearing ear muffs shipped out and arrived on time. Packaged well. This is our second pair. Very well made and work great. A must have item for hearing protection. We have had several different brands over the years and so far this pair works the best. I would recommend to anyone needing hearing protection.
customer_reviews.author: LLP

customer_reviews.title: The best purchase I've made in a very long time.
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing this product a few years back, I use this product 5-6 times per week. From mowing the lawn to weed whacking to using a miter saw and other tools while woodworking. These earmuffs do an excellent job of significantly diminishing the noise level. Coming from a family with hearing loss, I wish I had bought this product ages ago.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: My hearing is safe now :-)
customer_reviews.text: I wore them for about half an hour while mowing the lawn and were very comfortable the whole time and the sound deadening worked great. I tested them indoors by cranking up the volume on a 200W PA amplifier and did not feel any pain or discomfort on my eardrums. Really recommend them if you want to protect your hearing without breaking the bank
customer_reviews.author: ACustomer

customer_reviews.title: If you wear glasses, or have a big head....
customer_reviews.text: If you have a big head do NOT buy these. I just bought them and I tried them on, they have hard padding and give me a headache. I bought these for shooting, there is NO WAY you can wear these and glasses comfortably. I'm giving it two stars because they lie about how much they block, and the fact that my head feels like it's about to explode when wearing these.
customer_reviews.author: KimmieK

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye, Noisy World
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on these muffs in order to deal with a couple of problems. First, there is the neighbor upstairs who plays TV too loud. Also, we live in a small condo and my wife likes to watch TV also- and I like to read. I have tried ear plugs. They help, but do not solve sound issue. These muffs totally cut off the outside world the moment I put them on. I am very well pleased. If you need a quiet space for studying or just keeping separate from the noisy world I certainly recommended them. They are also soft and comfortable. They fold up so you can easily travel with them if you wish.
customer_reviews.author: JLS

customer_reviews.title: Work perfectly for a dog too
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our lab mix dog who is petrified of fourth of July and thunder. We put them on with the strap under his muzzle with his ears tucked carefully inside the muffs on the 4th. He had the best night ever-he laid on the couch and acted like it was any other normal day. Keep in mind, the fireworks around us are massive and since we live on a lake it echos. I put these on my head and could barely hear the TV right in front of me-they are great for eliminating noise. We are very happy they worked for our dog and they are a good back up if we humans ever need them.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Plastic broke... can't use
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these earmuffs and they worked fine for about 2 years... they looked good and did what they were supposed to do... right up till they broke.... put them on and the plastic on the earmuffs headband broke... both of them did this...2 pair, the metal part on the muff goes up to the headband and and is held in by plastic...thats right where the plastic snapped. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: eddy6053

customer_reviews.title: Best Shooter's Muffs for Indoor, Period...
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to wear them yesterday. As advertised, great sound blocking ability. Finally a pair of ear muffs I can wear at my indoor range WITHOUT having to add ear plugs. A little tight on my big head but I suspect that will get better. No idea why anyone would spend crazy money on electronic muffs (although my wife insists on wearing them), I don’t see the advantage? I must have at least four different pairs of shooters ear muffs, and my wife has a pair of Peltor Tacticals (but she still wears ear plugs with them??), but these are by far the best. The value on these is off the chart.
customer_reviews.author: SolMimi

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking!
customer_reviews.text: I have had and tried six different sets of muffs,rated from 27 to 33db NRR. When shooting rifles at the indoor range my ears were still getting damaged. It makes you wonder how these are so much better than a pair with almost the same rating but trust me they are. For indoor shooting these are now my go to and work best, by far. With ear plugs its even better. Only negative is the foam is a bit hard where they contact your head but then again this probably plays a role in them working the way they do. So if you are dealing with extremely loud noises these are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Moto99

customer_reviews.title: Low Tech (no battery) but well worth buying
customer_reviews.text: So my buddy has the $50 electric noise cancellation ear protevtion and he let me use them. His product is fantastic if you have $50 to spare. I did not. These are low tech BUT work fantastic. Last time we went shooting 45 cal and 9 MM these ear protection were very comfortable and the sound deadening was fantastic. Alternately, I could hear my buddies speak when we were not firing.
customer_reviews.author: JCF

customer_reviews.title: Good comfort / protection for the $
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Very comfortable for the price point. They maintain their comfort regardless of what size adjustment you make on them. They are in a sweet spot in terms of tightness/protection; they offer enough protection for those loud indoor ranges where everything is amplified but they aren't so tight that you can't communicate verbally amongst all that noise. I will probably just pony up a little more $ for an electronic noise cancelling headset next time but I am happy with them enough to have bought a second pair for my girlfriend to use. I would say I'd purchase them again but I already did!
customer_reviews.author: Zzz

customer_reviews.title: Great hearing protection for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: The earmuffs were perfect! I purchased these for my daughters and me to wear during the Blue Angels practice this week. I wore them covering one ear and then pulled down the other side during two high speed passes. My daughters (5 and 7) wore them the entire practice both days. In the past, we have used earplugs, but have never found a pair that would stay in my daughters' ears. With the earmuffs, I didn't have to worry about their ear protection. So far, they have held up very well for two uses. I hope to get several more uses out of them!!
customer_reviews.author: Norrin Radd

customer_reviews.title: Great sound reduction.....poor plastic design
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these less then a month ago..and I bought them based on reviews from users. I have to say that the reviews were spot on. These are EXTREMELY comfortable and drown out outside noise. I use them in a very loud hydrostatic skid steer....and being in an enclosed cabin.....you can guess how loud it is. My ONLY reason for not giving them a 5 star rating is because they already broke. The small piece of plastic that connects the ear piece to the head strap broke already. It is not something that can be glued in place. I wish they would make them a little more durable...but besides that minor flaw...they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Petergazinya420

customer_reviews.title: They were very good at noise reduction at a firing range, and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These inexpensive ear muffs are very effective even in the small shooting range where I go for target practice. They were comfortable to wear and my ears didn't feel crushed, sweaty, or itchy like I've felt in the past with different shooters earmuffs or ear plugs. You can even comfortably wear them over in ear plugs for double protection. I think they out perform other ear muffs that cost 2 or 3 times as much. A great value for target shooters.
customer_reviews.author: Jim From Boston

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: A very good product and a very obliging approach on the side of the seller. My first earmuffs, so I cannot provide no comparison to other models. In any case this one works well. Since I have quite a big head I had to use some strength to make the earmuffs comfortable (to make the angle between the metal holders and the upper bow bigger), but that's ok. To have to solve the opposite difficulty (a too weak squeeze) would be worse. Just do not expect a complete silence with these muffs in a noisy environment. To reach it you have to combine them with earplugs.
customer_reviews.author: Ladek

customer_reviews.title: Takes time to adjust to your head
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I initially felt that this headset was way too small. It seems with use this problem has been resolved. They fit snug on my head now. I use these for mowing the lawn and weed wacking-they are good for that. ORIGINAL REVIEW: Way too small. Should be listed as such. I do have a large head, but they were too tight for my wife who has a normal size head. If you have a big head, these are not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie W.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended if you shoot at indoor ranges
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after my pair of Howard Leight earpros broke. One problem that I had with the Howard Leights was that I shoot mostly indoors, and the muffs by themselves were not sufficient - I would have to double up with earplugs, then the muffs in order to make it more tolerable. With these muffs, I didn't need to double up, even though it was a busy Satuday with all ranges occupied, and multiple rifles being shot. The hearing protection these muffs provide is far superior, and I am extremely happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Collins

customer_reviews.title: Not super impressed
customer_reviews.text: Product box was damaged when received - hopefully I got new product, seems that way. Very nice folding design and weight is good. The ear pads are pretty firm - much more so than Peltors I've used in the past. The headband/clamping was good, but the seal around my ears did suffer. Doing a compare contrast between these and a pair of Peltor X5A, I found the Peltor to do a much better job quieting things. Ended up returning based on the packaging and going for another pair of X5A.
customer_reviews.author: PublicName

customer_reviews.title: What noise??
customer_reviews.text: O.k. just received this product today. My husband and I tried them on and they are extremely comfortable. They do exactly what they say they are going to do. You can hear something super super faint...which is good because you want to make sure that you are able to stay safe. We received this quickly too. Definitely worth the money and a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BuddysMommy

customer_reviews.title: they are not very comfortable because they squeeze my head very tight from the ...
customer_reviews.text: I use them to muffle the sounds when I try to sleep. They do not completely eliminate the sound but they work OK and reduce the noise to the reasonable level so that I can continue to sleep regardless of the commotion made by family members in the morning or evening. However, they are not very comfortable because they squeeze my head very tight from the top (not on my ears). Not sure if this could be adjusted but they give me the feel of tight uncomfortable head band. The feel goes away after a few minutes, once you adjust to it, but I would have preferred something better designed. Overall OK, does the job.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Good protection for kids and concerts
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for my 10 year old and his first real concert. As others noted, I did stretch these out for a few days before the concert. We were very close to the stage and he had these on almost the entire time and could hear clearly. He didn't complain at all and appreciated how these worked. I tried them also and noted no audio issues. Recommended for kids for concerts.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDad

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with how well they block out noise and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these for sensory therapy. I am very happy with how well they block out noise and the overall comfort of them. My only complaint is that when I wear them for several hours, it hurts my jaws. They are a snug fit which is good if youre using them outdoors, but extended use can make the area below your ear lobe a bit tender. Ive gotten used to it. With all of this said, this is the best pair Ive owned and Ive owned many -- overall very happy with them and would buy again. Also, they're durable. Bulky but they have to be to do their function -- not a criticism but worth noting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can't read your lips...
customer_reviews.text: What did you say? "Emumph Ah Veeaay ooot!!" AH!! Yes, these earmuffs ARE very good!! I used earplugs (properly: squish, hold top of ear to expand canal, insert, hold in place until expanded) until I got these. While I like the beding the back of the head connectors better than these over the head connectors, I can't say enough good about their ability to make things quiet. They are not "wear all day" muffs, as they squeeze fairly firmly to create and keep their seal. If used for shop work (put them on when grinding, sanding, ripping, etc.), as I use them, they are the bomb.
customer_reviews.author: Thrakorzog

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear to an extremely loud indoor rock concert for ear protection, as I have had problems with ear ringing and tinnitus in the past after being exposed to loud noises. Well, these did the job! I wore them comfortably for 3 hours and could enjoy the concert with no worries. I highly recommend these. They fit snugly, but are comfortable. Now my ears are protected, and I could still enjoy the concert. I'm so glad I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

product_meta.title: ClearArmor 141001 Shooters Hearing Protection Safety Ear Muffs Folding-Padded Head Band Ear Cups, Black
feature_bullets: SonicSeal - ClearArmor's exclusive sound technology provides better protection to save your hearing.
Comfortable, premium quality, lightweight, super soft ear ring foam for maximum long wear comfort.
Padded head band adjusts to fit most head sizes . . . Industrial grade. . . Engineered to last
Compact folding design for efficient storage. . . Snug reliable fit to keep our muffs on your head.
ANSI S3.19 & CE 352-1 Tested Certified. . . Over head ear muff, perfect fit swivel cup design

specifications.Performance Description: NRR Tested & Certified-ANSI S3.19 + CE EN 352.1
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars8,635 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
